vulnerability_findings.name: array-length-outside-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: Caching the array length outside a loop saves reading it on each iteration, as long as the array's length is not changed during the loop.

vulnerability_findings.name: state-variable-read-in-a-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: Replace state variable reads and writes within loops with local variable reads and writes.

vulnerability_findings.name: unnecessary-checked-arithmetic-in-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: A lot of times there is no risk that the loop counter can overflow. Using Solidity's unchecked block saves the overflow checks.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-prefix-increment-not-postfix
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using the prefix increment expression whenever the return value is not needed. The prefix increment expression is cheaper in terms of gas.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string

vulnerability_findings.message: ERC777 tokensReceived() reentrancy

vulnerability_findings.name: constant-function
vulnerability_findings.message: Address.isContract (ERC777.sol#467-476) is declared view but contains assembly code

vulnerability_findings.name: shadowing-local
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: function setInterfaceImplementer(address account, bytes32 interfaceHash, address implementer) external;
vulnerability_findings.message:
IERC1820Registry.setInterfaceImplementer.interfaceHash (local variable @ ERC777.sol#540) shadows:
	- IERC1820Registry.interfaceHash (function @ ERC777.sol#558)

vulnerability_findings.name: shadowing-local
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: function getInterfaceImplementer(address account, bytes32 interfaceHash) external view returns (address);
vulnerability_findings.message:
IERC1820Registry.getInterfaceImplementer.interfaceHash (local variable @ ERC777.sol#551) shadows:
	- IERC1820Registry.interfaceHash (function @ ERC777.sol#558)

vulnerability_findings.name: shadowing-local
vulnerability_findings.message:
ERC777.constructor.name (local variable @ ERC777.sol#657) shadows:
	- ERC777.name (function @ ERC777.sol#677-679)
	- IERC777.name (function @ ERC777.sol#18)

vulnerability_findings.name: shadowing-local
vulnerability_findings.message:
ERC777.constructor.symbol (local variable @ ERC777.sol#658) shadows:
	- ERC777.symbol (function @ ERC777.sol#684-686)
	- IERC777.symbol (function @ ERC777.sol#24)

vulnerability_findings.name: shadowing-local
vulnerability_findings.message:
ERC777.constructor.defaultOperators (local variable @ ERC777.sol#659) shadows:
	- ERC777.defaultOperators (function @ ERC777.sol#806-808)
	- IERC777.defaultOperators (function @ ERC777.sol#121)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-benign
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in ERC777._burn (ERC777.sol#962-981):
	External calls:
	- _callTokensToSend(operator,from,address(0),amount,data,operatorData) (ERC777.sol#973)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- _balances (ERC777.sol#977)
	- _totalSupply (ERC777.sol#976)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-benign
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in ERC777._send (ERC777.sol#933-952):
	External calls:
	- _callTokensToSend(operator,from,to,amount,userData,operatorData) (ERC777.sol#947)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- _balances (ERC777.sol#949)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-benign
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in ERC777.transfer (ERC777.sol#738-750):
	External calls:
	- _callTokensToSend(from,from,recipient,amount,,) (ERC777.sol#743)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- _balances (ERC777.sol#745)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-benign
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in ERC777.transferFrom (ERC777.sol#869-883):
	External calls:
	- _callTokensToSend(spender,holder,recipient,amount,,) (ERC777.sol#875)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- _allowances (ERC777.sol#878)
	- _balances (ERC777.sol#877)

vulnerability_findings.name: assembly
vulnerability_findings.message:
Address.isContract uses assembly (ERC777.sol#467-476)
	- ERC777.sol#474
